param.name: webhelp.logo.image.target.url

param.desc: Alternative text for the logo image.
param.name: webhelp.logo.image.alt

param.desc: If this parameter is set to false, then the 5-star rating mechanism is no longer included in the search results that are displayed on the Search tab (default setting is true).
param.name: webhelp.search.ranking

param.desc: Specifies either an XHTML fragment or the path to an XHTML file. It displays the given XHTML content as welcome message in the main page of the generated output.
param.name: webhelp.fragment.welcome

param.desc: Specifies the maximum depth of the topics top menu.
param.name: webhelp.top.menu.depth

param.desc: Specifies if topic tiles will be presented in the main page.
param.name: webhelp.show.main.page.tiles

param.desc: Specifies if Table of Contents (TOC) will be presented in the main page in a tree like (accordion) fashion.
param.name: webhelp.show.main.page.toc

param.desc: Specifies if the breadcrumb component will be presented in the Webhelp Responsive output.
param.name: webhelp.show.breadcrumb

param.desc: Specifies if the navigation links component will be presented in the Webhelp Responsive output.
param.name: webhelp.show.navigation.links

param.desc: Specifies if the print link component will be presented in the Webhelp Responsive output.
param.name: webhelp.show.print.link

param.desc: Specifies if the Expand/Collapse Sections button will be presented in the Webhelp Responsive output.
param.name: webhelp.show.expand.collapse.sections

param.desc: Specifies if the link to the index terms will be presented in the Webhelp Responsive output.
param.name: webhelp.show.indexterms.link

param.desc: Specifies if the topic page TOC component will be presented in the Webhelp Responsive output.
param.name: webhelp.show.topic.toc

param.desc: Specifies if the Publication TOC component will contain links for the chunked topics.
param.name: webhelp.publication.toc.hide.chunked.topics

param.desc: Specifies if the Publication TOC component will be presented in the Webhelp Responsive output for 'topic' files.
param.name: webhelp.show.publication.toc

param.desc: Specifies which links will be included in the Publication TOC of each topic.
param.name: webhelp.publication.toc.links

val.desc: The Publication TOC will include only the links to the current topic and its children.
The Publication TOC will include the links to the current topic, its children, and its ancestors.
The Publication TOC will include all links.

param.desc: Specifies if the top menu component will be presented in the Webhelp Responsive output.
param.name: webhelp.show.top.menu

param.desc: Specifies if the top menu component will be activated by a click event instead of the default activation (hover).
param.name: webhelp.top.menu.activated.on.click

param.desc: Specifies if the related links component will be presented in the Webhelp Responsive output.
param.name: webhelp.show.related.links

param.desc: Specifies if the related links from the nested topics of will be merged with the links in the parent topic. Thus the links will be moved from the topic content to the related links component.
param.name: webhelp.merge.nested.topics.related.links

param.desc: Specifies if the child links component will be presented in the Webhelp Responsive output.
param.name: webhelp.show.child.links

param.desc: Specifies if the toggle highlights component will be presented in the Webhelp Responsive output.
param.name: webhelp.show.toggle.highlights

param.desc: Specifies either an XHTML fragment or the path to an XHTML file. It displays the given XHTML content as footer in all generated WebHelp pages.

param.desc: Specifies if autocomplete feature is enabled in the WebHelp search text field.
param.name: webhelp.enable.search.autocomplete

param.desc: Specifies if the header section will remain sticky in the WebHelp Responsive output.
param.name: webhelp.enable.sticky.header

param.desc: Specifies if the publication toc will remain sticky in the WebHelp Responsive output.
param.name: webhelp.enable.sticky.publication.toc

param.desc: Specifies if the topic toc will remain sticky in the WebHelp Responsive output.
param.name: webhelp.enable.sticky.topic.toc

param.desc: Specifies if Kuromoji analyzer is enabled in the WebHelp search.
param.name: webhelp.enable.search.kuromoji.js

param.desc: Specifies the path to the folder containing the custom WebHelp Responsive template.
param.name: webhelp.publishing.template

param.desc: Specifies the name of the descriptor to be loaded from the WebHelp Responsive template package. If it is not specified, the first encountered descriptor will be automatically loaded.
param.name: webhelp.publishing.template.descriptor

param.desc: Specifies the tooltip position relative to the current topic in the Publication TOC.
param.name: webhelp.publication.toc.tooltip.position

param.desc: DEPRECATED: Use webhelp.fragment.head instead.
param.name: args.hdf

param.desc: DEPRECATED: Use webhelp.fragment.before.body instead.
param.name: args.hdr

param.desc: Specifies if search result items will be displayed on multiple pages or not.
param.name: webhelp.search.enable.pagination

param.desc: Specifies the number of search results items displayed on each page. This parameter is used only when the 'webhelp.search.enable.pagination' parameter is enabled.
param.name: webhelp.search.page.numberOfItems

param.desc: Specifies a list of words that should be excluded from the default stop words list. Use comma separator to specify more than one word. Sample: 'if,for'.
param.name: webhelp.search.stop.words.exclude

param.desc: Specifies a list of words that should be included in the default stop words list. Use comma separator to specify more than one word. Sample: 'if,for'.
param.name: webhelp.search.stop.words.include

param.desc: Specifies a list of HTML elements that will not be indexed by the search engine. The value of the @class attribute can be used to exclude specific HTML elements from indexing. For example, the 'div.not-indexed' value will not index all <div> elements that have a @class attribute with the value of 'not-indexed'. Use a comma separator to specify more than one element. Example: 'table,span.not-indexed,div.not-indexed'.
param.name: webhelp.search.index.elements.to.exclude

param.desc: Specifies if the 'sequence' value will be used by default when the collection-type attribute is not specified. This option is helpful if you want to have 'Next' and 'Previous' navigational buttons generated for all HTML pages.
param.name: webhelp.default.collection.type.sequence

param.desc: Specifies if the custom JavaScript module specified in the Publishing Template should be loaded or not via a 'require()' call using the RequireJS library.
param.name: webhelp.enable.template.js.module.loading

param.desc: Specifies the path to the XHTML file used to initialize the WebHelp Feedback system.
param.name: webhelp.fragment.feedback

param.desc: Specifies if responsive images that are displayed with a smaller dimension than their original size can be clicked to see an enlarged version of the image.
param.name: webhelp.show.full.size.image

param.desc: Replaces WebHelp's built-in search engine with your own custom search engine. The value of the parameter is the path to an XHTML file that contains the scripts required for your custom search engine to run.
param.name: webhelp.fragment.custom.search.engine.script

param.desc: Replaces the search results area with a custom XHTML content. The value of the parameter is the path to an XHTML file that contains your custom content.
param.name: webhelp.fragment.custom.search.engine.results

param.desc: Enables/disables automatically conversion of the values provided as HTML fragments to well-formed XML fragments. If it set to 'true', then the fragments that are not XML well-formed are converted. Otherwise, the transformation will fail if at least one HTML fragment is not well formed.
param.name: webhelp.enable.html.fragments.cleanup

param.desc: Path to the file containing properties for configuring the HTML to Well Formed XML converter. The available properties are described here: http://htmlcleaner.sourceforge.net/parameters.php#params
param.name: webhelp.html.fragments.converter.properties.file

param.desc: Specifies if the PDF link component will be presented in the Webhelp Responsive output.
param.name: webhelp.show.pdf.link

param.desc: Specifies the target URL for the PDF link.
param.name: webhelp.pdf.link.url

param.desc: Specifies the text for the PDF link.
param.name: webhelp.pdf.link.text

param.desc: Specifies the path or the URL of the image icon used for the PDF link.
param.name: webhelp.pdf.link.icon.path

param.desc: Specifies if the current topic ID should be appended as name destination at the end of the PDF link.
param.name: webhelp.pdf.link.name.destination.enabled

param.desc: Specifies if the data-ofbid attribute should be auto generated for block elements in the Webhelp Responsive output. If is set to 'yes' and Oxygen Feedback is integrated in the Webhelp Responsive output then you will be able to add and manage comments contextually at a specific location within the output page where block elements appear (e.g. section, paragraph, list, or table elements).
param.name: webhelp.enable.block.elements.id.generation

param.desc: Indicates how related links should be grouped. Either as a single group or as multiple groups depending on the links target type (topic, task or concept).
param.name: webhelp.rellinks.group.mode

param.desc: Controls the placement of the figure title relative to the image.
param.name: webhelp.figure.title.placement

param.desc: Controls the placement of the table title.
param.name: webhelp.table.title.placement

param.desc: DOCX template file
param.name: dotx.file

param.desc: Preprocess clean-up stylesheet
param.name: document.flat.xsl

param.desc: Core metadata stylesheet
param.name: core.xsl

param.desc: Custom metadata stylesheet
param.name: custom.xsl

param.desc: Main document stylesheet
param.name: document.xsl

param.desc: Comments stylesheet
param.name: comments.xsl

param.desc: List and title numberig stylesheet
param.name: numbering.xsl

param.desc: Footnote stylesheet
param.name: footnotes.xsl

param.desc: Document relations metadata stylesheet
param.name: document.xml.xsl

param.desc: Inkscape executable
param.name: inkscape.exec

extension-point.name: Extension point to pass parameters to the XSLT transformation that creates the HTML from the merged map
XSLT extension point for the post-processed merged DITA map to HTML5 transformation
Extension point to pass parameters for the XSLT post-processing of the merged DITA map before other stages.
XSLT extension point for post-processing the merged DITA map before other stages.

param.desc: Controls the placement of the figure title relative to the image.
param.name: figure.title.placement

param.desc: Specifies the name of the output file without file extension.
param.name: args.output.base

param.desc: Path to the Prince executable file (eg: "C:\path\to\prince.exe" on Windows) which should be run to generate the PDF.
param.name: css.processor.path.prince

param.desc: Path to the Antenna House executable file (eg: "C:\path\to\AHFCmd.exe" on Windows) which should be run to generate the PDF.
param.name: css.processor.path.antenna-house

param.desc: Path to the Oxygen PDF Chemistry executable file (eg: "C:\path\to\chemistry.bat" on Windows) which should be run to generate the PDF. If this parameter is not set and the publishing is done from Oxygen, then the custom installation directory specified in the "XML / PDF Output / CSS-based Processors" preferences page will be used, otherwise the system's PATH environment variable is used to find and run the Oxygen PDF Chemistry executable.
param.name: css.processor.path.chemistry

param.desc: Choose the formatting processor.
param.name: css.processor.type

param.desc: Path to the Java security policy file that will be used by the Chemistry process.
param.name: chemistry.security.policy

param.desc: Path to the folder that Chemistry will use to store its cache files and temporary files.
param.name: chemistry.security.workspace

param.desc: Path to an additional folder that Chemistry will use to read its CSS, images. (The process is already having read access to the input map folder, the publishing templates folder, and the OPE install folder.) Should only be used when the chemistry.security.policy parameter is set.
param.name: chemistry.security.resources.dir

param.desc: The host, specified as name:port, that Chemistry will use to get CSS, images. Should only be used when the chemistry.security.policy parameter is set.
param.name: chemistry.security.resources.host

param.desc: Restricts printing to high quality. Used for protecting the PDF Document
param.name: pdf.security.restrict.printhq

param.desc: Restricts assembling document. Used for protecting the PDF Document
param.name: pdf.security.restrict.assembledoc

param.desc: Restricts extracting text and graphics. Used for protecting the PDF Document
param.name: pdf.security.restrict.accesscontent

param.desc: Restricts filling in existing interactive forms. Used for protecting the PDF Document
param.name: pdf.security.restrict.fillinforms

param.desc: Restricts annotations. Used for protecting the PDF Document
param.name: pdf.security.restrict.annotations

param.desc: Restricts printing. Used for protecting the PDF Document
param.name: pdf.security.restrict.print

param.desc: Restricts printing. Used for protecting the PDF Document
param.name: pdf.security.restrict.copy

param.desc: Restricts editing content. Used for protecting the PDF Document
param.name: pdf.security.restrict.edit

param.desc: User password. The document can be opened using this password. When the owner password parameter is not specified, the user password gives full rights to the people using it. When the owner password parameter is specified, the people can open the document using the user password but restrictions will apply. Missing by default.
param.name: pdf.security.user.password

param.desc: Owner password. There are no restrictions for people using this password.
param.name: pdf.security.owner.password

param.desc: Controls structure element encryption. Activating this parameter can lead to scrambled text.
param.name: pdf.security.encrypt.structure.element

param.desc: When set to 'yes', the user comments, colored highlights and tracked changes are shown in the output.
param.name: show.changes.and.comments

param.desc: When set to 'yes', the user comments and tracked changes are shown in the PDF output as sticky note annotations - this is the default. When set to 'no' the comments and tracked changes are presented as footnotes.
param.name: show.changes.and.comments.as.pdf.sticky.notes

param.desc: When set to 'yes', the user comments and tracked changes are shown in the PDF output as changebars - this is the default. When set to 'no' the comments and tracked changes are presented as footnotes.
param.name: show.changes.and.comments.as.changebars

param.desc: When set to 'yes', the modified text is displayed in the PDF sticky note - this is the default. When set to 'no', no text from document is used in the PDF sticky note.
param.name: show.changed.text.in.pdf.sticky.notes.content

param.desc: When set to 'yes', the generated structures like table of contents, index list, front page, etc.. are removed from the output.
param.name: hide.frontpage.toc.index.glossary

param.desc: When set to 'shallow', only the first level topics (the chapters) are numbered. When set to 'deep', all the chapters and nested topics are numbered. When set to 'deep-chapter-scope' the pages, figures and tables numbers are reset at each chapter. The chapter number prefix all their labels.
param.name: args.css.param.numbering

param.desc: When set to 'yes', the sections are also numbered and they are listed in the table of contents.
param.name: args.css.param.numbering-sections

param.desc: Specifies whether chapter level TOCs are generated for bookmaps. When set to MINITOC, a small section with links is added at the beginning of each chapter. The default is BASIC.
param.name: args.chapter.layout

param.desc: Specifies that the PDF reader process should be closed before the final stage of the transformation. The readers are locking the PDF file and the transformation fails because it cannot overwrite this file. Available only when using the Chemistry processor on Windows, in conjunction with Acrobat Reader.
param.name: close.pdf.reader.before.transform

param.desc: Specifies that the top and bottom margins associated to a block element should be discarded when the block is at the top or bottom of the page.
param.name: drop.block.margins.at.page.boundary

param.desc: Specifies if the debug files generated during the transformation should be kept in the output folder.
param.name: args.keep.output.debug.files

param.desc: Enables the inclusion of code files that are located outside the DITA map folder hierarchy, referenced using the DITA coderef element.
param.name: args.allow.external.coderefs

param.desc: Specifies whether the navigation title defined in the topic or topicref should be used as the links text. By default it is used only in the TOC structure.
param.name: use.navtitles.in.all.links

param.desc: Specifies the version of the PDF.
param.name: pdf.version

param.desc: When set to 'yes', the PDF output will be generated in compliance with the PDF/UA standard.
param.name: pdf.accessibility

param.desc: When set to 'yes' (default), glyph substitution is enabled (if the particular font supports it). This applies to Latin scripts only (the substitutions are always enabled in other types of scripts). Note that disabling substitutions also disables Latin ligatures.
param.name: enable.latin.glyph.substitutions

param.desc: Specifies the images resolution.
param.name: image.resolution

param.desc: Indicates how related links should be grouped. Either as a single group or as multiple groups depending on the links target type (topic, task or concept).
param.name: args.rellinks.group.mode

param.desc: When set to 'yes' (default), media objects will not appear and an external link will be generated instead.
param.name: show.media.as.link

param.desc: When set to 'no' (default), elements in the glossary will be inserted following their document apparition order. Otherwise, elements in the glossary will be sorted alphabetically and grouped by their first letter.
param.name: sort.and.group.glossentries

param.desc: Specifies the path to the folder containing the custom PDF template.
param.name: pdf.publishing.template

param.desc: Specifies the name of the descriptor to be loaded from the PDF template package. If it is not specified, the first encountered descriptor will be automatically loaded.
param.name: pdf.publishing.template.descriptor

param.desc: You can use this to specify a list of CSS URLs to be used in addition to the default CSS list from the publishing template. The files must have URL syntax and be separated using semicolons.
param.name: args.css

param.desc: Specifies if the 'on page' label appears after links in the PDF output.
param.name: args.css.param.show-onpage-lbl

param.desc: Specifies the layout used for the titles.
param.name: args.css.param.title-layout

val.desc: The titles are displayed as inline.
The titles are displayed in table rows.

param.desc: Specifies if the debug files generated during the transformation should be kept in the output folder.
param.name: args.keep.output.debug.files

param.desc: Specifies if the CSS files specified in the publishing template or by the args.css parameter are applied on embedded SVG elements.
param.name: use.css.for.embedded.svg

param.desc: Controls the placement of the table title.
param.name: table.title.placement

param.desc: Specifies if a table caption should repeat on the other pages when the table spans on multiple pages.
param.name: table.title.repeat

param.desc: Shows a number for each areas defined in an image map.
param.name: show.image.map.area.numbers

param.desc: Shows the shapes of the areas defined in an image map, as a transparent overlay.
param.name: show.image.map.area.shapes

param.desc: Path to the hyphenation dictionaries directory.
param.name: args.hyph.dir

param.desc: Specifies the path of the root map file used to expand the key references in the published topic.
param.name: args.root.map

param.desc: Indicates whether the keys should be processed using the root map parameter.
param.name: args.enable.root.map.key.processing

param.desc: Specifies if the 'on page' label appears after links in the PDF output.
param.name: args.css.param.show-onpage-lbl

extension-point.name: Flag to use basedir as resource directory

param.desc: Specifies whether to generate headings for sections within task topics.
param.name: args.gen.task.lbl

param.desc: Specifies which links to include in the output.
param.name: args.rellinks

val.desc: Ancestor and parent links are not included.
Parent, ancestor, child, descendant, sibling, next, previous, and cousin links are not included.

param.desc: Specifies whether debugging information is included in the log.
param.name: args.debug

param.desc: Specifies whether the content of <draft-comment> and <required-cleanup> elements is included in the output.
param.name: args.draft

param.desc: Specifies how cross references to figures are styled in output.
param.name: args.figurelink.style

param.desc: Specifies a filter file to be used to include, exclude, or flag content.
param.name: args.filter

param.desc: Specifies whether the grammar-caching feature of the XML parser is used.
param.name: args.grammar.cache

param.desc: Specifies the main file for your documentation project.
param.name: args.input

param.desc: Specifies the base directory for your documentation project.
param.name: args.input.dir

param.desc: Specifies resource files.
param.name: args.resources

param.desc: Specifies the name of the output file without file extension.
param.name: args.output.base

param.desc: Specifies how cross references to tables are styled.
param.name: args.tablelink.style

param.desc: Specifies whether to crawl only those topic links found in maps, or all discovered topic links.
param.name: link-crawl

param.desc: Specifies whether DITA-OT deletes the files in the temporary directory after it finishes a build.
param.name: clean.temp

param.desc: Specifies where DITA-OT is installed.
param.name: dita.dir

param.desc: Specifies the location of the temporary directory.
param.name: dita.temp.dir

param.desc: Specifies a filter file to be used to include, exclude, or flag content.
param.name: dita.input.valfile

param.desc: Specifies whether filtering is done before all other processing, or after key and conref processing.
param.name: filter-stage

param.desc: Generate copy-to attributes to duplicate topicref elements.
param.name: force-unique

param.desc: Adjust how output is generated for content that is located outside the directory containing the DITA map.
param.name: generate.copy.outer

val.desc: Do not generate output for content that is located outside the DITA map directory.
Shift the output directory so that it contains all output for the publication.

param.desc: Specifies whether files that are linked to, or referenced with a @conref attribute, generate output.
param.name: onlytopic.in.map

param.desc: Specifies whether to warn or fail if content is located outside the directory containing the DITA map.
param.name: outer.control

val.desc: Fail quickly if files are going to be generated or copied outside of the directory.
Complete the operation if files will be generated or copied outside of the directory, but log a warning.
Quietly finish without generating warnings or errors.

param.desc: Specifies the name and location of the output directory.
param.name: output.dir

param.desc: Override for map chunk attribute value.
param.name: root-chunk-override

param.desc: Specifies the output format (transformation type).
param.name: transtype

param.desc: Specifies whether DITA-OT validates the content.
param.name: validate

param.desc: Specifies whether the @xtrf and @xtrc debugging attributes are generated in the temporary files.
param.name: generate-debug-attributes

param.desc: Specifies how DITA-OT handles errors and error recovery.
param.name: processing-mode

val.desc: When an error is encountered, DITA-OT stops processing
When an error is encountered, DITA-OT attempts to recover from it
When an error is encountered, DITA-OT continues processing but does not attempt error recovery

param.desc: Conserve memory at the expense of processing speed.
param.name: conserve-memory

param.desc: Specifies the default language for source documents.
param.name: default.language

param.desc: Remove broken related links.
param.name: remove-broken-links

param.desc: Specifies the name of the XSLT file used to rewrite filenames.
param.name: result.rewrite-rule.xsl

param.desc: Specifies the name of the Java class used to rewrite filenames.
param.name: result.rewrite-rule.class

param.desc: Temporary file store type.
param.name: store-type

param.desc: Run processes in parallel when possible.
param.name: parallel

param.desc: Specifies the directory within the EPUB to hold CSS files. Value should be a relative path, e.g. 'css'.
param.name: args.csspath

param.desc: Specifies the absolute or relative path of the graphic to use as the cover graphic for the EPUB. An absolute, platform-specific filename or a path relative to the root map to a JPG, PNG, or GIF to use as the cover graphic.
param.name: cover.graphic.file

param.desc: Specifies the maximum depth of the navigation table of contents. The default is the value of the d4p.max.toc.depth parameter, which itself defaults to "5".
param.name: d4p.max.nav.depth

param.desc: Specifies the maximum depth of the generated HTML table of contents.
param.name: d4p.max.toc.depth

param.desc: Specifies the name of the directory within the EPUB to hold all the topics.
param.name: topics.output.dir

param.desc: Turns on exclusion of auto-generated related links (as for normal HTML output) Controls base Toolkit processing by turning off the maplink-check and maplink targets, which has the effect of eliminating auto-generated related links. Note that explicitly-authored related links are not affected. This property cannot be set to true by default because it is a global property that affects all transformation types. You must set this property explicitly in order to suppress related links in the output.
param.name: epub.exclude.auto.rellinks

param.desc: Specifies the URI prefix stub to use in constructing the full EPUB ID value in the EPUB metadata. Any valid URI string. If this is a relative URI it should end with a "/" character. This parameter should normally reflect the organization that owns or publishes the EPUB, e.g., "http://mydomain.com/EPUB" or something similar.
param.name: epub.pubid.uri.stub

param.desc: Specifies the directory to use for EPUB-specific processing separate from the main Toolkit"s temp directory. An absolute platform-specific filename. This directory holds all the files that are then Zipped up to create the final EPUB file. By default temporary EPUB files are stored in a directory called "epub_temp" within the defined Toolkit temp directory.
param.name: epub.temp.dir

param.desc: Specifies the name of the directory within the EPUB to hold all images. Any valid directory name. The EPUB process automatically renames graphics to ensure that there are no name conflicts when the graphics are copied to into this directory from their source locations.
param.name: images.output.dir

param.desc: Specifies the type of EPUB to produce: EPUB 2 only, EPUB3 only, or Dual EPUB 2/3. Default is dual 2/3.
param.name: d4p.epubtype

param.desc: The URI of the EPUB font manifest file. The font manifest specifies the fonts to embed in the EPUB.
param.name: epub.font.manifest

param.desc: Indicates whether or not to apply font obfuscation to fonts flagged as obfuscated in the font manifest.
param.name: epub.obfuscate.fonts

param.desc: The path, within the generated EPUB, to store embedded fonts. Default is 'fonts'.
param.name: epub.fonts.output.dir

param.desc: Indicates whether or not to generate CSS @font-face rules for embedded fonts as configurated in the font manifest. Default 'false' (don't generate CSS rules)
param.name: epub.generate.css.font.rules

param.desc: The @class value to use for generated title-only topics, e.g., '- topic/topic concept/concept '
param.name: title.only.topic.class.spec

param.desc: The @class value to use for generated title-only topic titles, e.g., '- topic/title '
param.name: title.only.topic.title.class.spec

param.desc: Indicates whether or not to generate an HTML table of contents in addition to the required navigation ToC (EPUB 2 .ncx file or EPUB 3 nav element)
param.name: epub.generate.html.toc

param.desc: Set to 'false' to prevent copying of the built-in CSS files. By default the normal OT-provided CSS files are copied into the EPUB.
param.name: epub.copy.system.css

param.desc: Specifies JavaScript file to include in all generated HTML Files
param.name: epub.javascript.file

param.desc: Specifies directory withih EPUB to put included JavaScript
param.name: epub.javascript.dir

param.desc: Specifies whether or not to generate a back-of-the-book index
param.name: html2.generate.index

param.desc: Specifies whether or not to generate a dynamic TOC in the output.
param.name: html2.generate.dynamic.toc

param.desc: Specifies whether or not to generate an HTML frameset file for the map.
param.name: html2.generate.frameset

param.desc: Specifies whether or not to generate a back-of-the-book index
param.name: html2.generate.index

param.desc: Specifies whether or not to generate a static TOC in the output
param.name: html2.generate.static.toc

param.desc: Specifies that the output should be zipped and returned using this name.
param.name: args.eclipsehelp.jar.name

param.desc: Specifies the region for the language that is specified by the args.
param.name: args.eclipsehelp.country

param.desc: Specifies the base language for translated content, such as en for English.
param.name: args.eclipsehelp.language

param.desc: Specifies the name of the person or organization that provides the Eclipse help.
param.name: args.eclipse.provider

param.desc: Specifies the version number to include in the output.
param.name: args.eclipse.version

param.desc: Specifies the symbolic name (aka plugin ID) in the output for an Eclipse Help project.
param.name: args.eclipse.symbolic.name

param.desc: Specifies whether to generate a label for each image; the label will contain the image file name.
param.name: args.artlbl

param.desc: Specifies whether to copy the custom .css file to the output directory.
param.name: args.copycss

param.desc: Specifies the name of a custom .css file.
param.name: args.css

param.desc: Specifies the location of a copied .css file relative to the output directory.
param.name: args.csspath

param.desc: Specifies the directory that contains the custom .css file.
param.name: args.cssroot

param.desc: Specifies the language locale file to use for sorting index entries.
param.name: args.dita.locale

param.desc: Specifies an XML file that contains content for a running footer.
param.name: args.ftr

param.desc: Generate metadata for parental control scanners, meta elements with name="security" and name="Robots".
param.name: args.gen.default.meta

param.desc: Specifies an XML file that contains content to be placed in the document head.
param.name: args.hdf

param.desc: Specifies an XML file that contains content for a running header.
param.name: args.hdr

param.desc: Specifies whether to hide links to parent topics in the HTML5 output.
param.name: args.hide.parent.link

param.desc: Specifies whether to include the DITA class ancestry inside the HTML5 elements.
param.name: args.html5.classattr

param.desc: Specifies the value of the @target attribute on the <base> element in the TOC file.
param.name: args.html5.contenttarget

param.desc: Generate TOC file from the DITA map.
param.name: html5.toc.generate

param.desc: Specifies the base name of the TOC file.
param.name: args.html5.toc

param.desc: Specifies the value of the @class attribute on the <body> element in the TOC file.
param.name: args.html5.toc.class

param.desc: Specifies a custom XSL file to be used for TOC generation.
param.name: args.html5.toc.xsl

param.desc: Specifies whether the content of <indexterm> elements are rendered in the output.
param.name: args.indexshow

param.desc: Specifies the file extension for HTML5 output.
param.name: args.outext

param.desc: Specifies a custom XSL file to be used instead of the default XSL transformation.
param.name: args.xsl

param.desc: Specifies whether to generate a navigation TOC in topic pages.
param.name: nav-toc

val.desc: Partial TOC that shows the current topic

param.desc: The file path to a directory that contains resources files. All files from this directory will be copied to the root of the WebHelp output.
param.name: webhelp.custom.resources

param.desc: The file path of an image used as favicon.
param.name: webhelp.favicon

param.desc: Specifies the location of a well-formed XHTML file that contains the Custom Search Engine script from Google. The value must be a file path.
param.name: webhelp.google.search.script

param.desc: Specifies the location of a well-formed XHTML file that contains the Google Custom Search Engine element "gcse:searchresults-only". The value must be a file path. You can use all supported attributes for this element. It is recommended to set the "linkTarget" attribute value to "frm" for frameless (iframe) versions of WebHelp, or to "contentWin" for frameset versions of WebHelp. The default value for this attribute is "_blank" and the search results will be loaded in a new window. If this parameter is not specified, the following code will be used: <gcse:searchresults-only linkTarget="frm"></gcse:searchresults-only>
param.name: webhelp.google.search.results

param.desc: Enables the display for header links of the following types: Parent Topic, Next Topic, Previous Topic.
param.name: args.hide.parent.link

param.desc: Specifies if stemming is used when searching in WebHelp generated content.
param.name: use.stemming

param.desc: The value of the "priority" element in the generated sitemap.xml file. Possible value is any fractional number between 0.0 (least important priority) and 1.0 (most important priority). For example: 0.3, 0.5, 0.8, etc. The "priority" element is optional in the sitemap.xml. If you leave this parameter set to its default empty value, the priority element is not added in sitemap.xml.
param.name: webhelp.sitemap.priority

param.desc: The value of the "changefreq" element in the generated sitemap.xml file. The "changefreq" element is optional in the sitemap.xml file. If you leave this parameter set to its default empty value, the changefreq element is not added in sitemap.xml.
param.name: webhelp.sitemap.change.frequency

param.desc: File path of the user dictionary that will be used by the Kuromoji indexer for indexing Japanese content in the WebHelp pages.
param.name: webhelp.search.japanese.dictionary

param.desc: Base URL for all the "loc" elements in the generated sitemap.xml file. The value of a "loc" element is composed of the value of the base URL parameter, followed by the value of the href attributes of the topicref elements (a relative file path). The "loc" element is mandatory in the sitemap.xml file. If you leave this parameter set to its default empty value, the "loc" element will only contain the value of the href attributes
param.name: webhelp.sitemap.base.url

param.desc: Set this parameter if you have out of memory problems generating WebHelp. It will increase processing time but decrease the memory footprint.
param.name: webhelp.reload.stylesheet

param.desc: When set on 'yes', the user comments, colored highlights and trackchanges are shown in the output.
param.name: webhelp.show.changes.and.comments

param.desc: The path of the file that contains name patterns for HTML files that should not be indexed by the WebHelp search engine. Each line of this file is taken to be an exclude pattern. The patterns are considered relative paths, relative to the output directory. '*' matches zero or more characters, '?' matches one character. You can read more about patterns here: https://ant.apache.org/manual/dirtasks.html#patterns
param.name: webhelp.search.custom.excludes.file

transtype.desc: Merge DITA content to single XML file
transtype.name: merged

param.desc: (deprecated. Use editlink.ditamap.edit.url instead) The custom URL of the DITA Map suitable for opening in oXygen XML Web Author
param.name: editlink.remote.ditamap.url

param.desc: (deprecated. Use editlink.ditamap.edit.url instead) The URL of the Web Author installation
param.name: editlink.web.author.url

param.desc: The URL of DITA Map opened in Web Auhtor or Content Fusion. For Web Author simply open the root DITA Map in Web Author and copy from browser's address bar the whole URL. The value may look like 'https://www.oxygenxml.com/oxygen-xml-web-author/app/oxygen.html?url=webdav-https%3A%2F%2Fwww.oxygenxml.com%2Foxygen-xml-web-author%2Fplugins-dispatcher%2Fwebdav-server%2Fdita%2Fflowers%2Fflowers.ditamap&author=Anonymous'. For Content Fusion create a task with all DITA files including the Map, open the task in browser, go to the root DITA Map file and copy from browser's address bar the whole URL. The value may look like 'https://fusion.oxygenxml.com/tasks/asdalongidasd/edit/flowers.ditamap'.
param.name: editlink.ditamap.edit.url

param.desc: Additional query parameters to be appended at each edit URL. E.g: '&showDitaMapView=true'
param.name: editlink.additional.query.parameters

param.desc: Present a relative reference to the original topic file before each topic title.
param.name: editlink.present.only.path.to.topic

param.desc: (deprecated. Use editlink.ditamap.edit.url instead) The custom URL of the DITA Map suitable for opening in oXygen XML Web Author
param.name: editlink.remote.ditamap.url

param.desc: (deprecated. Use editlink.ditamap.edit.url instead) The URL of the Web Author installation
param.name: editlink.web.author.url

param.desc: The URL of DITA Map opened in Web Auhtor or Content Fusion. For Web Author simply open the root DITA Map in Web Author and copy from browser's address bar the whole URL. The value may look like 'https://www.oxygenxml.com/oxygen-xml-web-author/app/oxygen.html?url=webdav-https%3A%2F%2Fwww.oxygenxml.com%2Foxygen-xml-web-author%2Fplugins-dispatcher%2Fwebdav-server%2Fdita%2Fflowers%2Fflowers.ditamap&author=Anonymous'. For Content Fusion create a task with all DITA files including the Map, open the task in browser, go to the root DITA Map file and copy from browser's address bar the whole URL. The value may look like 'https://fusion.oxygenxml.com/tasks/asdalongidasd/edit/flowers.ditamap'.
param.name: editlink.ditamap.edit.url

param.desc: Additional query parameters to be appended at each edit URL. E.g: '&showDitaMapView=true'
param.name: editlink.additional.query.parameters

param.desc: Present a relative reference to the original topic file before each topic title.
param.name: editlink.present.only.path.to.topic

param.desc: (deprecated. Use editlink.ditamap.edit.url instead) The custom URL of the DITA Map suitable for opening in oXygen XML Web Author
param.name: editlink.remote.ditamap.url

param.desc: (deprecated. Use editlink.ditamap.edit.url instead) The URL of the Web Author installation
param.name: editlink.web.author.url

param.desc: Additional query parameters to be appended at each edit URL. E.g: '&showDitaMapView=true'
param.name: editlink.additional.query.parameters

param.desc: The URL of DITA Map opened in Web Auhtor or Content Fusion. For Web Author simply open the root DITA Map in Web Author and copy from browser's address bar the whole URL. The value may look like 'https://www.oxygenxml.com/oxygen-xml-web-author/app/oxygen.html?url=webdav-https%3A%2F%2Fwww.oxygenxml.com%2Foxygen-xml-web-author%2Fplugins-dispatcher%2Fwebdav-server%2Fdita%2Fflowers%2Fflowers.ditamap&author=Anonymous'. For Content Fusion create a task with all DITA files including the Map, open the task in browser, go to the root DITA Map file and copy from browser's address bar the whole URL. The value may look like 'https://fusion.oxygenxml.com/tasks/asdalongidasd/edit/flowers.ditamap'.
param.name: editlink.ditamap.edit.url

param.desc: File path to the kindlegen executable. e.g. "/Users/ekimber/apps/KindleGen_Mac_i386_v1.1/kindlegen".
param.name: kindlegen.executable

param.desc: Specifies the XSL processor.
param.name: pdf.formatter

param.desc: Specifies the user configuration file for FOP.
param.name: args.fo.userconfig

param.desc: Show Oxygen track changes and comments
param.name: show.changes.and.comments

param.desc: Show change bars based on Oxygen tracked changes. Requires show.changes.and.comments to be set.
param.name: show.changebars

param.desc: Show only change bars for Oxygen tracked changes, the inserts are styled normally, the deletion are hidden. Requires show.changes.and.comments to be set.
param.name: show.changes.and.comments.as.changebars.only

param.desc: Insertion color for Oxygen tracked changes, specified as a plain color (i.e. red, yellow, blue), or with a hexadecimal equivalent (i.e. #FFFFFF). The default value is 'blue'.
param.name: ct.insert.color

param.desc: Deletion color for Oxygen tracked changes, specified as a plain color (i.e. red, yellow, blue), or with a hexadecimal equivalent (i.e. #FFFFFF). The default value is 'red'.
param.name: ct.delete.color

param.desc: Comment background color for Oxygen tracked changes, specified as a plain color (i.e. red, yellow, blue), or with a hexadecimal equivalent (i.e. #FFFFFF). The default value is 'yellow'.
param.name: ct.comment.bg.color

param.desc: Zendesk host where to upload the aticles.
param.name: zendesk.host

param.desc: Authentication user name
param.name: zendesk.username

param.desc: Zendesk API Token used for authentication.
param.name: zendesk.token

param.desc: The category in which to upload the articles. Categories are the top-level organizing containers of the help center. Categories contain sections.
param.name: zendesk.category.name

param.desc: The section in which to upload the articles. Sections contain related articles.
param.name: zendesk.section.name

param.desc: When you create a draft article, it is saved but not published, so that you can continue working on it until it's ready to publish.
param.name: zendesk.create.drafts

param.desc: Zendesk permission group that controls who edits and publishes articles.
param.name: zendesk.permission.group.name

param.desc: Specifies the @class attribute value to use for title-only topics generated from topicheads.
param.name: title.only.topic.class.spec

param.desc: Specifies the @class attribute value to use for title-only topics generated from topicheads.
param.name: title.only.topic.title.class.spec

param.desc: Names the output file organization strategy to use for generated files. One of the pre-defined strategies or a user-implemented name. If the strategy name is not recognized (that is, not handled by the base code or an extension) then the default strategy is applied. The default is dependent on the specific transformation type. For HTML2 the default is "as-authored". For EPUB it is "single-dir".
param.name: html2.file.organization.strategy

param.desc: Specifies if custom images will be used when generating PDF output with the 'pdf2' transtype. Set this parameter to 'no' to use the default images from the PDF2 plugin or your custom images.
param.name: com.oxygenxml.use.custom.note.images

param.desc: Specifies the XSL processor.
param.name: pdf.formatter

param.desc: Specifies whether draft-comment and required-cleanup elements are included in the output.
param.name: publish.required.cleanup

param.desc: Specifies the user configuration file for Antenna House Formatter.
param.name: axf.opt

param.desc: Specifies the path to the Antenna House Formatter executable.
param.name: axf.cmd
